Identification.LongTitle: Order Respecting the Remission of Excise Duty on Spirits Destroyed by Accident

Section.Text: This Order may be cited as the Spirit Destruction Remission Order.

Definition.Text: bonding warehouse has the same meaning as assigned to that term by the Act. (entrepôt)

Section.Text: Subject to section 4, remission of the excise duty imposed pursuant to subsection 1(1) of Part I of the schedule to the Act and payable pursuant to section 52 and subsection 54(1) of the Act is hereby granted where spirits are destroyed due to accidents incurred

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: when transporting the spirits in bond; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: while handling the spirits in licensed bonding warehouses.

Section.Text: Remission under section 3 may be granted on the condition that a request therefor in writing is forwarded to the Minister of National Revenue together with documentary evidence that establishes to his satisfaction that the spirits

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: have not been illegally removed from the bonding warehouse;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: were not destroyed through the failure of the shipper, warehouse operator or transportation company to exercise reasonable diligence and effective control of his operations; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: were destroyed before being released from the control of excise officers.
